arts.ttl: Leeds United set for summer transfer windfall as sporting director makes big admission
arts.sum: Eintracht Frankfurt sporting director Timmo Hardung has revealed the club will try to sign Rasmus Kristensen from Leeds United on a permanent basis this summer As quoted by Fussball Transfers, Hardung said: "We’ll try (to sign Kristensen permanently).

arts.ttl: 'Massive win' - Will dramatic Leeds victory over Sunderland be decisive?
arts.sum: A late Pascal Struijk double and a last-gasp win over Sunderland took Leeds back to the top of the Championship.

arts.ttl: Leeds United eye summer move for former Tottenham defender on a free transfer
arts.sum: Leeds United are on track for a long-awaited return to the Premier League, leading the Championship table and closing in on direct promotion. As the Whites set their sights on top-flight football once again, bolstering the squad during the summer transfer window is sure to be a major focus. One standout name linked with a […] The post Leeds United eye summer move for former Tottenham defender on a free transfer appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: Why Daniel Farke will be suspended for Leeds United's huge title clash with Sheffield United
arts.sum: Leeds United boss Daniel Farke will not be on the touchline for next week's huge Championship clash with Sheffield United. It means Farke's men are now seven points clear at the top of the Championship after Burnley dropped points at Preston North End. With 13 games to go, Leeds are in a great position for a return to the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Regis Le Bris hits the nail on the head with Leeds United assessment after late Sunderland loss
arts.sum: Head coach Regis Le Bris praised the impact of Leeds United's substitutes following Sunderland's 2-1 defeat at Elland Road this evening. Le Bris told Sky Sports: "It's a shame to concede the second goal like we did at the end of the game.

arts.ttl: Leeds return to the top after super-sub Struijk strikes twice to sink Sunderland
arts.sum: The news that a national poetry centre is to be established in Leeds proved the source of considerable pride in West Yorkshire on Monday. By 10pm on a bitterly cold night at Elland Road, any notions that Leeds would capture the mood courtesy of a suitably cadenced performance had been thoroughly disabused as Daniel Farke’s side fought their way to a dramatic last-gasp win after Wilson Isidor had given Sunderland the lead. Yet if it was hardly poetic, substitute Pascal Struijk’s gamechanging double returned Leeds to the top of the Championship, leaving them two points ahead of Sheffield United, seven clear of third-placed Burnley and 10 in front of Régis Le Bris’s team. arts.ttl: 'Extraordinary scenes!' Late, LATE Struijk show earns Leeds HUGE win over Sunderland
arts.sum: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Leeds United and Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Sub Struijk strikes twice late on as Leeds hit back to beat Sunderland
arts.sum: Pascal Struijk scored twice as Leeds staged a stunning late comeback to beat Sunderland 2-1 to return to the top of the Championship.

arts.ttl: Leeds United player ratings vs Sunderland with Struijk and Rothwell super subs
arts.sum: The hosts went into half-time a goal down after Wilson Isidor found the net on 32 minutes after getting the wrong side of Ethan Ampadu. Pascal Struijk headed home from a brilliant Joe Rodon cross as the substitutes combined brilliantly.

arts.ttl: Pascal Struijk scores last-gasp winner against Sunderland to send Leeds top
arts.sum: The Dutch defender and Joe Rothwell came on with 20 minutes remaining and the pair combined for both of the Whites’ two late goals.
